word: He took [the children] in His arms,
parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Middle - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: To take (fold) in my arms. From en and a derivative of agkale; to take in one's arms, i.e. Embrace.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: To put, place, lay, set, fix, establish. A prolonged form of a primary theo to place.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
On, to, against, on the basis of, at.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Neuter 3rd Person Plural
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: (lit: I speak well of) I bless; pass: I am blessed. From a compound of eu and logos; to speak well of, i.e. to bless.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Neuter 3rd Person Plural
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
